body: (Just in case anyone had the same question I did -- Jetty 8 does indeed only require Java 6 unlike Jetty 9)
Yep - that's the reason this is proposing going to 8 instead of 9... :)

That is a fairly ambiguous message from jenkins :-) cc @pwendell

@mateiz Here's a more complete version.  Note that this includes the sql/hql distinction we discussed, but only for Java.  I'll do the scala one in a separate PR.

The docs here are also updated: http://people.apache.org/~pwendell/catalyst-docs/sql-programming-guide.html

Looks like this one involved only very minor changes. So I'm gonna go ahead and merge this.
@andrewor14 Thanks for the quick fix!

Is this good to go? I can see the argument that `SparkListenerShutdown` is probably not doing anything now, but removing it should be in another PR. To stick with the current semantics it's more correct to treat the two events as different events?
@mridulm I resolved the PR as well https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-1376
Thanks, merged.

Hey Xiangrui, why have a MLContext at all? Why not just make the input methods part of MLUtils? This is the pattern we've followed with other input methods (e.g. KafkaUtils and TwitterUtils in Spark Streaming), and I think it will make more sense long-term. An MLContext isn't actually a SparkContext so it's weird to also call it a context.
One other thing, for the centering, will we create a utility function for it later? We should add a JIRA. I agree that they need to be removed by default.
@mengxr Ah... I totally understand your mean. Code is on the way.
Hey @mateiz take another look ?
Merged build triggered.
Merged build started.
@mateiz Centering will be available after https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/268 gets merged.

@mateiz For `MLContext`, it used to be a context-like due to implicit conversion. I'm a little bit afraid to see `MLUtils` becomes a collection of random stuffs. To me, `MLContext` is for users (for input/output and general machine learning operations), while `MLUtils` is for developers.
